column4: I'm thinking about beginning to use ubuntu. I have a few questions though.
I'm assuming it uses apt-get as a package manager?
synaptic is the default gui frontend, accessible from the menus
- I see. Are the packages it gets compiled from source, or are they binary?
not sure i understand what you're asking, do you mean like gentoo is installed from source?
Aye.
no
- Could you possibly name some of the differences I might encounter between gentoo and ubuntu?
never used gentoo. ubuntu is based on debian, only it is much nicer
by nicer, i mean there is much less maunal configuration to do
I have only seen Ubuntu with Gnome as the WM. Is it possible to use *box?
probably, I see fluxbox listed
- D'you know how easy it would be to get my dlink card working?
- Would I still have to build the acx100 drivers (or is there native support)?
no idea. you could check on #debian-boot to see if the installer supports that NIC
if the installer does, than the installed system will to. if not, the installed system still might
- what version of Xorg does Ubuntu use?
it uses xfree86 for no, next release should be changing to xorg
- Ah.
you can access them as a network share, or mounted vfat or ntfs if it is a local drive
It is a local drive :) A local drive that will be formatted.
